<p>Come along to talk about code, research tools, and open science in a social environment!</p><p>Possible resources to prepare your session’s hack:</p><p>Beginner: <a href="https://malikaihle.github.io/Introduction-RStudio-Git-GitHub/">https://malikaihle.github.io/Introduction-RStudio-Git-GitHub/</a> and <a href="https://malikaihle.github.io/Collaborative-RStudio-GitHub/">https://malikaihle.github.io/Collaborative-RStudio-GitHub/</a><br>Advanced: <a href="https://happygitwithr.com/">https://happygitwithr.com/</a></p><p><strong>Sessions’ agenda:</strong></p><ul>
<li>Brief round of introductions and description of the problems you’ll be working on during that session</li>
<li>Formation of possible groups or tandems, if participants have tips to exchange on certain topics</li>
<li>Hack</li>
<li>Wrap-up: progress and next steps</li>
</ul>
<p>Learn more about the Hacky Hour initiative <a href="../../meetups/hackyhour/index.html" title="Hacky Hour">here</a>.</p><div class="g-clear"></div>
